</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Agents of Edgewatch</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #158: Sixty Feet Under](/Sources.aspx?ID=47) pg. 75

**Price** 120 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This surprisingly sturdy 3-foot-by-3-foot clay tile resembles a thick pressure plate. It can support up to 500 pounds of weight atop it before it is destroyed. The _floorbell's_ nature is obvious at a glance, but mundane or magical means can obscure or camouflage the tile (such as by covering it in scattered leaves or by casting an [_illusory object_](/Spells.aspx?ID=160) spell) to make it harder to detect.

**Activate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> command, Interact;     **Effect** The _floorbell_ must be activated on level ground. When you do, specify the amount of weight that triggers the _floorbell's_ alarm system. When the amount of weight you specify (or more) is placed on the _floorbell_, it emits an ear-piercing wail clearly audible to a range of 150 feet. A _floorbell_ can also ring an alarm if a weight you specify is removed from the _floorbell_, such as if you activated it while a heavy sack was on it.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
